description: We're developing a proposal to create a new rail service in west London as part of the London Overground network

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["We are considering a new rail service on existing, underused rail lines in west London as part of the London Overground network. The West London Orbital rail line would run from Hounslow and Kew Bridge towards Hendon and West Hampstead in the north."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
This aim of this work is set out in the Mayor's Transport Strategy .
The service would connect the Opportunity Areas of:
In the north, it's proposed that the service would run along the Dudding Hill line - this is currently used for freight services only.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Enable the creation of at least 8,800 new homes and 23,000 new jobs","Reduce journey times for public transport journeys across west and northwest London","Alleviate crowding on congested rail and Tube lines","Offer much-needed transport alternatives to encourage people to shift to sustainable transport and improve air quality"]}
We have worked closely with the West London Alliance, Network Rail and our West London borough partners to develop a strategic outline business case for the proposal.
The case shows that the West London Orbital scheme could address critical strategic issues facing west and northwest London.
We're now considering the next steps for developing the scheme and how such a scheme could be funded.
